metadata.title: CVE-2019-10208 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was discovered in postgresql versions 9.4.x before 9.4.24, 9.5.xbefore 9.5.19, 9.6.x before 9.6.15, 10.x before 10.10 and 11.x before 11.5where arbitrary SQL statements can be executed given a suitable SECURITYDEFINER function. An attacker, with EXECUTE permission on the function, canexecute arbitrary SQL as the owner of the function.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
